Whoops, wrong discussion board...
Soldiers do not benefit from banner of command. They do not have their own attack damage--their attacks deal damage based on Azir's level and AP.

> Soldiers do not benefit from banner of command. They do not have their own attack damage--their attacks deal damage based on Azir's level and AP.

Do Heimer's turrets not operate off of Heimer's AP and level as well? So what is the technical difference that allows Heimer turrets to benefit from banner but not soldiers?

Heimer's turrets deal damage based on their own AD stat, which scales off Heimer's AP and the ability level. The Sand Soldiers Azir uses deal damage solely based off Azir's level and AP, they don't have an AD or AP stat to increase to deal more damage with via Banner of Command. Sand Soldiers are effectively an interactable ability not a pet, identical in nature to Orianna's ball.
Give them a base damzge of 1 point at all points of the game, then Adjust the scaling if Banner is too strong on them. Just let us build Banner.

You realize giving the Soldiers 1 AD/AP would do nothing right? Aside from them being untargetable (Therefor incapable of being affected by auras) the way Banner of Command works would mean nothing would be accomplished even with it.

Banner of Command increases the AD and AP of all ally minions by 15%, it doesn't just give a 15% damage bonus effect.

Base of 1 Point, and still scaling with Azirs AP and Level. I'm am 100% Sure that means that they'll get some benefit out of it.

Or are you telling me the 15% Boost applies *BEFORE* scaling? Pretty sure that's not the way it works with {{champion:74}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:60}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:1}}  and their respective pets, considering their pets have scaling damage as well.

The fact that they're untargetable, and therefore immune to auras, is really the issue.

The difference between pets and the Soldiers is that the Soldiers aren't using stats to apply their damage, they're literally a spell behind a body. Each attack they do is just a spell cast, they don't use AD or AP to calculate the damage, so the Banner boost has no effect on the damage being dealt even if they were affected by it.

To get Banner to interact with the Sand Soldiers would mean completely remaking the Sand Soldiers themselves to be actual minions. They're not pets, clones, or minions they're a re-skinned version of The Ball from Orianna's kit.
You have no idea how disappointed this makes me.
Please Change this :/ Banner of Command seems like THE item to build on Azir. Please please change Azir or the Item to work toghther.
Why don't you show up in the Red Tracker? Sneaky Zenon. Was Banner ever tested on an iteration of him? Seems a waste of an opportunity for a disused item to find a home.
I agree with this statement.

Personally I think there should be a specific exception for Azir's soldiers. It's the Banner of Command, Azir does almost all of his work via commanding his soldiers, this item seems like a perfect fit for him.

That said, even if it still doesn't effect his soldiers, it's still a potent item on him. AP, CDR, and more pushing power, as well as more lane control. It'll turn him into a terrifying lane-altering monster. Between his pushing power with his wave clear, the safety of split pushing into enemy territory thanks to his passive giving him a turret to fall back to, a dash escape, and the ability to just wall enemies off from chasing him, add increased minion damage, and the enhanced pushing power of a Promoted minion, either in his lane, or in a different lane, his map control will be awesome. It won't be a rush item since it doesn't effect his soldiers, but it'll be a good second, or third item.
